name: Travelodge Dublin Airport Ballymun

reviews.text: I booked this hotel after reading some other reviews on here, all of which seemed to be positive.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel and rooms

reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location for the airport, the city is not too far and is within easy reach via one of the regular buses or taxis. From the outside the hotel looks clean and modern, with the interior and rooms being no exception. The rooms were light, spacious and well-designed with bathroom, comfortable beds, tea/coffee making facilities and a flat-screen TV.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Lovely Romms

likes.disliked: — Location - Bit far from City Centre and Nightlife

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel based on the reviews on this site, and was terribly disappointed.
reviews.title: Really Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know Ballymun has a bad reputation but I was hoping to prove evryone wrong by coming home and saying I had a nice time there. However, the area is, to be honest, really scary, and not nice to look at - deserted, half-demolished tower blocks. I was not aware that there were such devestated-looking areas in Ireland. There were lots of groups of boys hanging around which i found quite intimidating.
reviews.title: wonderful hotel,top marks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The actual hotel is a lovely, modern building. The reception staff are very friendly and more than helpful, and had to contend with the underground carpark gate continually not working. (Which it didn't with us either in the way in or out)
reviews.title: It's okay
Comfortable, but noisy
reviews.text: The bedroom is clean and modern, and fully equipped. however, the soundproofing is very bad. We were woken by a man and woman arguing loudly, we couldn't work out if the sound was coming from outside or the next room.
Another problem there is the tea and coffee facilities. Either the water or the milk was undrinkable, which was a shame as this is a nice touch in a hotel.
reviews.title: looks good, but some big faults

reviews.text: First of all do not let the word Ballymun put you off staying in this hotel. It is a really great modern hotel with easy access to the city and the airport. It also has an underground carpark for use.
reviews.title: Don't go by the name!!

reviews.text: The rooms are quite spacious but as a previous poster stated there are only double beds rather than king/queen size. Doesn't bother me but some may see otherwise. The bathroom is quite clean. There was also a LCD tv, the first time I have seen one in a hotel.
reviews.title: It's a good hotel- Honest.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just a couple of things to watch out for though. The directions to the hotel on the website state turn left at a roundabout which now longer exists, so it is a left turn into a crescent instead. The other thing is if you don't have breakfast included with the price of the room you have to fork out a whopping €15 per person if you decide to avail of it.
reviews.title: Fantastic

aka: Travelodge Dublin Airport Ballymun Hotel Dublin
description: The Travelodge Dublin Airport Ballymun is ideally located 4 km from Dublin Airport and 5km from Dublin City and offers spacious modern rooms at budget prices. Stay in Dublin for less this year, for business, catching a flight from Dublin Airport or visiting Dublin City for shopping and leisure.
